definitions.definition: A building, wing or dependency set apart and adapted for lodging and feeding (and training) animals with hoofs, especially horses.
definitions.example: There were stalls for fourteen horses in the squire's stables.

definitions.definition: (metonymy) All the racehorses of a particular stable, i.e. belonging to a given owner.
A set of advocates; a barristers' chambers.
An organization of sumo wrestlers who live and train together.
A group of prostitutes managed by one pimp.
To put or keep (an animal) in a stable.
Relatively unchanging, permanent; firmly fixed or established; consistent; not easily moved, altered, or destroyed.
definitions.example: He was in a stable relationship.

definitions.definition: Of software: established to be relatively free of bugs, as opposed to a beta version.
definitions.example: You should download the 1.9 version of that video editing software: it is the latest stable version. The newer beta version has some bugs.

definitions.definition: (of a sorting algorithm) That maintains the relative order of items that compare as equal.
